question: Hello-- I really need help figuring out what is wrong with my son.  Any advice would be very helpful.  He is 6 years old.For over eight weeks he has been urinating frequently, very thirsty, hungry, he has lost a little weight, has headaches, has circles under eyes.  So, basically classic symptoms of diabetes.However, his tests, mostly done in the beginning, all came back normal. Urine, fasting, GTT, A1C.  Could he still be in the early stages of developing diabetes?We had allergy tests done and celiac and they were all normal also.  Of course it is great to get normal results but it doesn't change the fact that we are dealing with these symptoms every day!Our doctor is sort of brushing us off, probably hoping it will go away. I can't blame him there!Should we be pushing for more tests?  IDoes anyone have a similar experience?Thanks so much
title: Need help with son's symptoms
